pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, April 10, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Monday, April 10, 2017:

Arras, French Republic

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will be presented with a statue by the City of Barrie.

Arras City Hall
Arras, French Republic

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 8:30 a.m.

Lile, French Republic

10:30 a.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will depart for Deauville.

Closed to media

Deauville, French Republic

11:30 a.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will arrive in Deauville.

Deauville Airport
Deauville, French Republic

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity

Courseulles-sur-Mer, French Republic

12:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will visit the Juno Beach Centre.

Juno Beach Centre
Courseulles-sur-Mer, French Republic

1:05 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will observe a moment of remembrance at Juno beach.

Juno Beach
Courseulles-sur-Mer, French Republic

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity

1:40 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Juno Beach Centre
Courseulles-sur-Mer, French Republic

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

Bény-sur-Mer, French Republic

2:30 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will lay flowers and observe a moment of silence at the Cross of Sacrifice.

Canadian War Cemetery
Bény-sur-Mer, French Republic

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

Deauville, French Republic

6:30 p.m. The Prime Minister and Ms. Grégoire Trudeau will depart for Ottawa, Canada.

Closed to media

Note: all times local.
